doc.field: Populated Places: USGS Virginia Geographic Names Information System (GNIS)

This collection (stacked series) of datasets is provided to the UVA Library’s Scholars’ Lab by the USGS, and is provided AS-IS with no guarantees as regards to its accuracy or temporal currency. It pertains primarily to locations of named places within Virginia as well as related natural features. * // * All layers have the following attributes: Feature Name, feature class, state and county name, lat & lon coordinates, elevation, and USGS Quad map name. * // * Datasets/Layers included in this datastack (broken up by feature type): * gnis09_va_all = everything (master shapefile).
* gnis09_va_popplace = populated places.
* gnis09_va_cultural = airport, bridge, building, cemetery, church, civil, crossing (interchange), dam, harbor, hospital, levee, military, mine, post office, school, slope (waterslide), tower, trail, tunnel, and locale (misc but everything from shopping centers to piers).
* gnis09_va_natural = arch (natural stone arch), bar, basin, bay, beach, bend (river bend), canal, cape, channel, cliff, crater, falls, flat, forest (state or national), gap, gut (tidal creek), island, lake, park, pillar (rock outcrop), range (mt.), rapids, reserve (wilderness area), reservoir, ridge, sea, spring, summit, swamp, and woods. -- includes natural resource management areas, and artificial water bodies.
* gnis09_va_svmouth = linear stream and valley features -- the primary coordinate (used to create the shapefile point) is the mouth/outflow.
* gnis09_va_svhead = linear stream and valley features -- the source coordinate (used to create the shapefile point) is the headwaters/beginning.
* gnis09_va_other = area (generalized but of variable scale) and census designated places.
